name: Joe Tex
description:
'''Yusuf Hazziez''' (born '''Joseph Arrington Jr.'''; August 8, 1935 â€“ August 13, 1982), known professionally as '''Joe Tex''', was an American singer and musician who gained success in the 1960s and 1970s with his brand of [[Southern soul]], which mixed the styles of funk, country, gospel, and rhythm and blues.

His career started after he was signed to [[King Records (USA)|King Records]] in 1955 following four wins at the [[Apollo Theater]]. Between 1955 and 1964, he struggled to find hits, and by the time he finally recorded his first hit, "[[Hold What You've Got]]" in 1964, he had recorded 30 previous singles that were deemed failures on the charts. He went on to have four million-selling hits: "Hold What You've Got" (1965), "[[Skinny Legs and All (song)|Skinny Legs and All]]" (1967), "[[I Gotcha (Joe Tex song)|I Gotcha]]" (1972), and "[[Ain't Gonna Bump No More (With No Big Fat Woman)]]" (1977).

Tex was nominated for the [[Rock & Roll Hall of Fame]] six times, most recently in 2017.
